selected_quotes: Agunos grupos de genes de humanos y perros evolucionaron en paralelo debido a la domesticación.
Dogs may have been domesticated much earlier than we thought - perhaps by scavenging with humans, finds scientists
New research puts split between #wolves and Chinese indigenous #dogs at 32,000 years ago, earlier than thought
#icanhazpdf The genomics of selection in dogs and the parallel evolution between dogs... deckerje at missouri dot edu

citation.abstract: The genetic bases of demographic changes and artificial selection underlying domestication are of great interest in evolutionary biology. Here we perform whole-genome sequencing of multiple grey wolves, Chinese indigenous dogs and dogs of diverse breeds. Demographic analysis show that the split between wolves and Chinese indigenous dogs occurred 32,000 years ago and that the subsequent bottlenecks were mild. Therefore, dogs may have been under human selection over a much longer time than previously concluded, based on molecular data, perhaps by initially scavenging with humans. Population genetic analysis identifies a list of genes under positive selection during domestication, which overlaps extensively with the corresponding list of positively selected genes in humans. Parallel evolution is most apparent in genes for digestion and metabolism, neurological process and cancer. Our study, for the first time, draws together humans and dogs in their recent genomic evolution.
citation.title: The genomics of selection in dogs and the parallel evolution between dogs and humans.

Parallel evolution between man and his best friend

http://www.nature.com/ncomms/journal/v4/n5/full/ncomms2814.html

¿Quiénes fueron los abuelos de los perros?

Los perros son nuestros mejores amigos, se les encuentra por todo el mundo y nos han acompañado por miles de años. Sin embargo, todavía no conocemos con precisión los detalles del nacimiento de nuestra amistad.
